p: Eugenol and eucalyptol, by themselves had better activity than the essential oil where they are present. In some cases, such as with eucalyptol that is present in bay laurel essential oil, the larvicidal activity doubles when the molecule is pure. This suggests that the other constituents of the essential oil have antagonistic interactions with eucalyptol. The low larvicidal activity of eucalyptol (1,8-cineol) has been reported previously against larvae of Aedes aegypti [ 33], Anopheles anthropophagus [ 34] and Culex pipiens [ 35], however it has been shown to be effective as a repellent in foods and highly effective as an ovipositional repellent [ 33], however the effect did not last for more than 30 min [ 36].
